There are less than three months until the election, an election that
 will decide the next President of the United States. *The man elected
 will be the president of ALL Americans, not just the Democrats or the
 Republicans.
 
 **To show our solidarity as Americans, let's all get together and show
 each other our support for the candidate of our choice. *It's time that
 we all came together, Democrats and Republicans alike.
 
 **If you support the policies and character of President George W.
 Bush, please drive with your headlights 'ON' during the day.
 
 If you support John Kerry, please drive with your headlights 'OFF'
 at night
 
 
 -Unknown

Apparently he thinks that suggesting that Kerry supporters get themselves killed is either:

 I'm not sure which would reflect more poorly on him.

 
 I think the mere fact that he felt posting such a "joke" was worthy of debate is what reflects poorly on him. The act itself is contemptuous and suspect. On the other hand it's a clear sign of someone who has complete disregard for his fellow man. 
 
 So, in reflection I have no other choice but to retaliate with an article found in a Rogers, Arkansas paper "The Morning News": 
 
 GOP Rehearsing Its Off Broadway Production   
 Sunday, Aug 29, 2004
 
 Column By Bob Caudle 
 I'm Bob Caudle, and I approved this message.
 
 Being a moderate Republican, I get all the latest updates on GOP issues.
 
 With the Republican National Convention coming up, I've just received a schedule of events, and a first draft of President Bush's comments.
 
 I thought I'd share. First, the schedule:
 
 6:00 p.m. - Opening prayer.
 
 6:15 p.m. - Supplementary opening prayer.
 
 6:30 p.m. - Prayer in thanks of first two prayers.
 
 6:45 p.m. - New energy policy presented by Exxon.
 
 7:00 p.m. - Canonization of former President Reagan.
 
 7:15 p.m. - Additional prayers.
 
 7:30 p.m. - Opening remarks by Halliburton officials.
 
 8:00 p.m. - Prayer for the safety and well-being of Ken "Kenny-boy" Lay.
 
 8:15 p.m. - Additional remarks by Halliburton officials, including Vice President Dick Cheney.
 
 8:30 p.m. - Celebrate marriage of two former gays who have been counseled straight.
 
 8:45 p.m. - New healthcare polices presented by proposed HMO leader, Martha Stewart.
 
 9:00 p.m. - Invasion of Iran or North Korea (TBA).
 
 9:15 p.m. - Halliburton contributes $1.4 billion to Republican party.
 
 9:30 p.m. - Former President Reagan elevated to savior; Holy Trinity now referred to as "The Quads."
 
 9:45 p.m. - Bush undergoes plastic surgery to look more like Reagan.
 
 10:00 p.m. - Cheney tells Ron Reagan, Jr. to go f*** himself.
 
 10:15 p.m. - Recall of troops from accidental invasion of South Korea (Bush: "Damn, the south is one of our allies? My bad.")
 
 10:30 p.m. - Dancing around the golden calf.
 
 11:00 p.m. - Propose Constitutional Amendment outlawing all marriages in San Francisco.
 
 11:15 p.m. - New forestry policy presented by Weyerhaeuser officials.
 
 11:45 p.m. - Thanking God for his wisdom in choosing Bush as president.
 
 12:00 p.m. - Closing prayers (lasting until 2 a.m.).
 
 2:00 a.m. - Hookers arrive for all delegates..
 
 And here's a first draft of Bush's acceptance speech:
 
 "My name is ... uh ... George W. Bush, and I'm reporting for dooty.
 
 "My fellow 'Mericans. As you know, since 9-11, that's 9-1-1, our country has been involved in a brutal, world-wide war against tourism.
 
 "We have embarked on an ambitious goal, governmentalintizing airport check point agents to make sure we keep tourists off our airplanes. If we can't keep the tourists off, we want to make it as difficult as possible for them to boarder our airlines. The more tourists we can keep from getting up, the more we can keep tourism down. We want to make sure that flying is no longer an option for tourists.
 
 "Our Homeland Security Secretary, Condeleza Ridge, has recommended that the few remaining National Guard Reservationists, that we don't already have in Viet..., Iraq, be sent to beaches along the Gulf Coast to search out tourist training grounds. It's my belief that these beaches are being used by tourists as training grounds because of their abundance of sands.
 
 "Sands is our troupes worst enema. It gets between their tows, slows their movement, and renders them effectively ineffective. So, we're going to crank it down. We're going to ratchet it up. We're going to make it as difficult as possible for tourists to get to the beaches. Whether it be beaches by the ocean or beaches by the gulf ... (smirk for effect) our intelligence has told us that most beaches are located near water.
 
 "Water is also dangerous. Not only does it cause drowning when intaken in large quantitties, it also leads to beaches -- and therefore leads to tourists.
 
 "To some up, beaches, tourists. Tourists, water. Water, beaches, tourists. And as my Dad said, my Dad, he was president before I was, anyway, he said, and I might add, 'Thousand points of light. Stay the course.'
 
 "Thank you, and good night.
 
 "Is this mike off? That reporter over there's a real a****** ..."
jim's trucking

Well duh. I get that. But what does that have to do with people who support Kerry? Are you suggesting they should die?
No.
 
 
 
 
 Certainly the joke doesn't suggest that they are stupid as you are asking them to be stupid which of course they will not comply with. 
No more so than the joke about "How many (put in a descriptor) does it take to change a light bulb?...Five! One to hold the bulb and four to turn the ladder!" That joke is not all that funny, but it does give someone with a bit of imagination a mental picture of that actually happening.
 
 
 So what is so funny about this joke?
Apparently, nothing to you.
 
 
 
 Or are you just interested in cutting down those who support Kerry?
No. They do a sufficient job of that all by themselves.
 
 
 Since this wasn't really meant for debate, I suppose I made a mistake in not posting it on the Open forum. My bad.
jim's trucking

 Don't fret. I get the joke, Jim. And I'm a socialist! I thought it was funny too.
 If I wanted to be a stick-in-the-mud and analyse it though, someone driving with no headlights might kill a Bush voter in the process :) Wouldn't that be funny too?
 
 PS
 We're having our federal election here in Australia too!
 
 Also, what's it matter who you vote for when your electoral college has the potential to cast their votes in a manner differently from what you might wish.
